result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION/COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO CHERY B. OS
Scanned:  Order to Produce signed on 1/20/2016.

Defendant Omar Castillo in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Omar Castillo in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO (0) days time served.  CONSECUTIVE TO 13CF427,  12CF6064 AND 15CM3725.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  UNLESS ALREADY COMPLETED/PAID.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

* Restitution payable to WAL-MART for TWENTY-FOUR DOLLARS AND EIGHTY-EIGHT CENTS ($24.88) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief.
By agreement of the Parties matter is rescheduled to 01-25-2016 at 03:00pm for Sentencing.

Defendant Omar Castillo in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Omar Castillo in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has picked up a new case.  State does not oppose that matter being transferred to Br. 33.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant has picked up a new case.  State will grant an adjournment in order to resolve both matters.  Review hearing/Revocation set for 12-08-2015 at 1:30pm.  sdg

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Omar Castillo not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Parties request an adjourned review hearing date.  Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Castillo in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Renden contacted court to schedule case for plea and sentencing.  Case scheduled for plea and sentencing on 06-25-2015 at 1:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Walmart - 6701 S 27th Street, Franklin WI
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Omar Castillo in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Omar Castillo in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
